00020 
00021 //! unary plus operation (does nothing, but is required for completeness)
00022 template<typename T1>
00023 arma_inline
00024 const Base<typename T1::elem_type,T1>&
00025 operator+
00026 (const Base<typename T1::elem_type,T1>& X)
00027   {
00028   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00029   
00030   return X;
00031   }
00032

00035 //! Base + scalar
00036 template<typename T1>
00037 arma_inline
00038 const Op<T1, op_scalar_plus>
00039 operator+
00040 (const Base<typename T1::elem_type,T1>& X, const typename T1::elem_type k)
00041   {
00042   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00043   
00044   return Op<T1, op_scalar_plus>(X.get_ref(), k);
00045   }

00048 
00049 //! op + scalar, level 2
00050 template<typename T1>
00051 arma_inline
00052 const Op<T1,op_scalar_plus>
00053 operator+
00054 (const Op<T1,op_scalar_plus>& X, const typename T1::elem_type k)
00055   {
00056   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00057   
00058   return Op<T1, op_scalar_plus>(X.m, X.aux + k);
00059   }

00094 const Glue<T1, Op<T2,op_diagmat>, glue_plus_diag>
00095 operator+
00096 (const Op<T2,op_diagmat>& Y, const Base<typename T1::elem_type, T1>& X)
00097   {
00098   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00099   
00100   return Glue<T1, Op<T2,op_diagmat>, glue_plus_diag>(X.get_ref(), Y);  // NOTE: order is swapped
00101   }
00102 
00103 
00104 
00105 //! diagmat + diagmat
00106 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00107 inline
00108 Mat< typename promote_type<typename T1::elem_type, typename T2::elem_type>::result >
00109 operator+
00110 (const Op<T1, op_diagmat>& X, const Op<T2, op_diagmat>& Y)
00111   {
00112   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00113   
00114   typedef typename T1::elem_type eT1;
00115   typedef typename T2::elem_type eT2;
00116   
00117   typedef typename promote_type<eT1,eT2>::result out_eT;
00118   
00119   promote_type<eT1,eT2>::check();
00120   
00121   const unwrap<T1> tmp1(X.m);
00122   const unwrap<T2> tmp2(Y.m);
00123   
00124   const Mat<eT1> A(tmp1.M);
00125   const Mat<eT2> B(tmp2.M);
00126   
00127   arma_debug_assert_same_size(A.n_rows, A.n_cols, B.n_rows, B.n_cols, "matrix addition");
00128   
00129   Mat<out_eT> out(A.n_rows, A.n_rows);
00130   out.zeros();
00131   
00132   for(u32 i=0; i<A.n_rows; ++i)
00133     {
00134     out.at(i,i) = upgrade_val<eT1,eT2>::apply( A.at(i,i) ) + upgrade_val<eT1,eT2>::apply( B.at(i,i) );
00135     }
00136   
00137   return out;
00138   }
00139 
00140 
00141 
00142 //
00143 // addition of Base objects with different element types
00144 //
00145 
00146 
00147 
00148 //! Base + Base
00149 template<typename eT1, typename T1, typename eT2, typename T2>
00150 arma_inline
00151 Mat<typename promote_type<eT1,eT2>::result>
00152 operator+
00153 (const Base<eT1,T1>& X, const Base<eT2,T2>& Y)
00154   {
00155   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00156   
00157   promote_type<eT1,eT2>::check();
00158 
00159   const unwrap<T1> tmp1(X.get_ref());
00160   const unwrap<T2> tmp2(Y.get_ref());
00161   
00162   const Mat<eT1>& A = tmp1.M;
00163   const Mat<eT2>& B = tmp2.M;
00164   
00165   Mat< typename promote_type<eT1,eT2>::result > out;
00166   glue_plus::apply_mixed(out, A, B);
00167   
00168   return out;
00169   }

00182 operator+

00184   {
00185   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00186
